text: Arnold snagged a rare Pikachu pokemon card and Laura got her vest from Gensler. Arie was born in to the world and her first words were "transportation-oriented development"

Arnold is now in his 3rd year of working as a data scientist at Hughes. For him, 2024 was a year of reconnecting with old friends - one of his best friends moved back from overseas to the area, and he got to see another friend from Michigan and meet his two kids. He has also dived deeper into his passion for collecting Pokemon trading cards, which he re-discovered back in late 2023. He has built up quite a collection.

Most importantly of all this year, he became a father. He got to experience what he calls "unlocking a new dimension of joy and love" that comes with being a father - playing with Arie, watching her grow, and seeing just how much she (and her parents) are so loved and supported by family, friends, and church community. She is such a sweet girl, and Arnold and Laura are truly blessed and grateful to God for this wonderful gift that is Arie.

Laura entered her 5th year of working at Gensler, which means she's fully vested now (yay!) and got a cheeky little vest from Gensler to commemorate it. This year she's had the opportunity to start working on some research around increasing climate resilience for all types of infrastructure around the world, as well as a project aimed at correlating elements of the built environment with experience indicators in urban environments.

Laura experienced pregnancy for the first time this year (6 out of 10 experience) and gave birth to lil Arie baby at the end of September! As a result, she's stepped back from a lot of serving roles at church and has put a pause on her photography business for now in order to focus on learning how to keep Arie alive. Laura enjoys reading to Arie, having deep conversations with her, and telling her about things like how microwaves work.

Arnold and Laura traveled a lot this year to make the most of their last months of being just a family of 2. In addition to the trips to Raleigh and Hawaii with the rest of the family, they also took a short European adventure/babymoon to Barcelona and Lisbon!
Couldn't go to Barcelona without experiencing some of Gaudi's famous works
Every meal was delicious - including this paella
Of course, had to find the best coffee in the city
Spent 24 hours in Lisbon and of course had to try some Portuguese egg tarts
And find some beautiful architecture wherever they go

Arie "Jelly" Cheng is the new mascot of the An family. She loves looking at picture books, listening to music (Hamilton & Prince of Egypt soundtracks are her faves), morning snuggles, warm baths, and listening to Arnold trying to beatbox.
